definition: to show no understanding of the times (idiom); cannot adapt to current circumstances/not amenable to reason
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means

sentences.english: They put a few posters on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 这是一些不识时务的意见。

sentences.english: This is the opinions of some rip van winkle .
sentences.chinese: 这是一些不识时务的意见。

sentences.english: They regarded me as "old-fashioned" and behind the times.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为我老“土”，不识时务。

sentences.english: This is the opinions of some Rip Van Winkle.
sentences.chinese: 这是一些不识时务的意见。

sentences.english: This is the opinion of some Rip van Winkle.
sentences.chinese: 这是一些不识时务者的意见。

sentences.english: One of the most common grievances aired at politicians is that they are out of touch.
sentences.chinese: 说到政客，人们最常抱怨的便是他们的不识时务。

sentences.english: This is the opinion of some Rip Van Winkle .
sentences.chinese: 这是一些不识时务的意见。

definition: not knowing when to come or leave (idiom); with no sense of propriety
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
fail to appreciate sb's kindness/not know how to appreciate favors
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
to fail to see the larger issue (idiom)/to fail to grasp the big picture
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
unable to accomplish anything but liable to spoil everything (idiom)/unable to do anything right/never make, but always mar
pinyin: cheng2 shi4 bu4 zu2 , bai4 shi4 you3 yu2
